rationale: The vulnerability is using MD5 hash algorithm which is cryptographically insecure. The fix replaces MD5 with SHA256, which is a secure hash algorithm recommended by security standards. This change maintains the exact same functionality - creating a hex digest of the title for signature purposes - while addressing the security concern. No other changes are needed as the API remains identical between hashlib.md5() and hashlib.sha256().
patch:
--- a/app.py
+++ b/app.py
@@ -153,7 +153,7 @@
     db.session.add(todo)
     db.session.commit()
-    sig = hashlib.md5(title.encode()).hexdigest()
+    sig = hashlib.sha256(title.encode()).hexdigest()
     print(f"Storing signature for todo {todo.id}: {sig}")
 
     return jsonify({
